result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric A St. John was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges, a ONE DOLLAR ($1.00) fine by 05-22-2019 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
*Court ordered Child Support payable to TRACI SJ in the amount of FIFTEEN THOUSAND SIX HUNDRED SEVENTY-TWO DOLLARS AND FORTY-TWO CENTS ($15,672.42) converted to a civil judgment FORTHWITH subject to tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric A St. John

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Reclassifying 'Restitution' as 'Repayment'.  Awaiting Signature,  Filed, sdg.

*  'RESTITUTION' IS HEREBY CONVERTED TO 'CHILD SUPPORT'.
Reclassifying 'Restitution' as 'Repayment'.  Awaiting Signature,  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Eric A St. John in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Gilbert Urfer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the State,  Court VACATED the pleas on Count(s) 1, 2 and 3.  Court ordered COUNT(S) 2 and 3 DISMISSED and READ-IN for the purposes of Sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.22(3), a class A Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges, a ONE DOLLAR ($1.00) fine by 05-22-2019 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court ordered Restitution payable to TRACI SJ in the amount of FIFTEEN THOUSAND SIX HUNDRED SEVENTY-TWO DOLLARS AND FORTY-TWO CENTS ($15,672.42) converted to a civil judgment FORTHWITH subject to tax intercept.
Review hearing on May 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric A St. John in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  William T Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State WITHDREW their Motion to REVOKE.  Defendant will need to make TIMELY and REGULAR payments.  Defense concurred with the State.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for May 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric A St. John in court by telephone with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  William T Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant has had some financial issues as well as a disagreement between the Defendant and the Mother of Defendant's child.  Defense advised that Defendant made efforts to make a 'good faith' payment on today's date.  State requested an adjournment for a period of THIRTY (30) DAYS in order to allow the Defendant to return to the area.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  State will consider any forthcoming payments before the next hearing prior to REVOKING.  COURT TOOK THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  DEFENDANT TO APPEAR IN PERSON ON THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for November 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric A St. John in court by telephone with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State advised that Defendant is current with the Agreement.  State advised that they will stipulate to the WAIVER of Defendant's appearance (he will appear by telephone) as long as he remains current and compliant with the DPA.  Defense advised that they will be stipulating to an EXTENSION of the DPA from FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS to SIXTEEN (16) MONTHS.  State advised that the stipulation to extension is correct.  Court approved the extension of the DPA.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  COURT WAIVED DEFENDANT'S APPEARANCE AT THE NEXT HEARING (HE WILL APPEAR BY TELEPHONE).

  Review hearing scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric A St. John in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State advised the Court that Defendant is in compliance.  Defense to provide documentation of payments for NOVEMBER, 2015.  Defense advised the Court that Defendant currently resides in Louisiana and travelled to Milwaukee for the purposes of this Hearing.  Defense advised the Court that Defendant is FULLY aware of the ramifications of non-compliance.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  State requests a THREE (3) MONTH adjournment for Review.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric A St. John in court with Attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing.  AS TO COUNTS #1, #2 AND #3:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionaire and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.   The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended for a period of FIFTEEN (15) months.
 
Court ordered case adjouned for Review Hearing in Branch 33, Judge Ashley, on January 12, 2016 at 8:30am.
Original Information filed by ADA Maureen Atwell on behalf of the State.

Defendant Eric A St. John in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2014, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 09-25-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court for Plea Hearing.

Defendant Eric A St. John in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy and waived reading of the Original Information.

Defendant Eric A St. John not in court; currently resides in New Orleans, LA.  Attorney Andrew Golden appeared as a friend of the Court.  Maureen Ami Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Preliminary Hearing today.
Defendant does NOT appear; currently resides in New Orleans.
Statements made.
Court finds good cause to waive the preliminary hearing time limits.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Preliminary Hearing.

**Court ordered a bench warrant to issue, but stayed the issuance until the next court date.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (6/23/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 07-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Eric A St. John
Current: 4707 Baccich Street, New Orleans, LA 70122   (Effective: 06-22-2015)
Prior: 4707 Baccich Street, New Orleans, LA 70122

Defendant Eric A St. John in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Anthony E. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 06-22-2015 at 01:30pm
